body.name: Nuwave Bravo Air Fryer Toaster Oven Combo, 12-in-1 Smart Convection Ovens Countertop 30QT with Integrated Digital Temperature Probe, Tray, Basket, Fry Rack and Recipes
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
features: MORE THAN 12-IN-1 – The NuWave Bravo XL Air Fryer includes 12 preset cooking functions for air frying, baking, broiling, roasting, toasting, grilling, dehydrating, reheating, defrosting and making restaurant-quality waffles, pizza and bagels with the single press of a button
ULTRA-LARGE CAPACITY: 2-layer even cooking, The oven’s 30QT capacity 1 layer fits up to 6 slices of bread, a 13-inch pizza, or a 10lbs whole chicken. Fully meet family needs

UNBEATABLE TEMPERATURE CONTROL – The toaster oven combines conduction, convection and radiant heat to circulate and penetrate food with cyclonic hot air that ranges between 100°F and 450°F with precise 5°F increments. The digital temperaure probe virtually eliminate the possibility of over or under-cooking by measuring the internal temperature of your food while it cooks. This advanced probe will shut off the convection oven once your meat, seafood or poultry reaches a set temperature

NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY – With intuitive digital controls and 40 easy-to-follow recipes included, it’s never been easier to air fry, bake, roast, broil and so much more. And with the precise temperature and time control, fully-adjustable quartz heating elements and fan speeds, just about anyone can cook like a pro

HIGH-QUALITY CONSTRUCTION – From the brushed stainless steel of the exterior to the heat-resistant tempered glass door to the heavy-duty cooking rack, Stainless Steel Fry Rack, Stainless Steel Tray, Silicone Pad, and non-stick Enamel Baking Pan and Broiler Rack, everything that comes with the NuWave Bravo Air Fryer Toaster Oven Combo is made with quality in mind

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does a great job cooking.
reviews.reviewText: Does a great job cooking. Very helpful options. A little tricky to set up unyil you practice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Excellent product so far. Gave as a Christmas gift to a man and he loves the quality of the product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy Cook/Bake 'n Eat
reviews.reviewText: High quality item. Size,Heat Power and clear function buttons are above other Brands. Upper and lower heat are adjustable both individually from 0% to 100% for variety plates. Will buy again!Price vs product received is right priced.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The appliance takes some getting used to. You have to read the instructions. This is a little more detailed than the one I previously had. It's a great one stop shop!I am really enjoying it. It isn't compact, by any means, so you'll want to take that into consideration.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars All in one
reviews.reviewText: Good quality in craftsmanship, easy to use, good heat and big.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Needs 1 important accessory!
reviews.reviewText: We use this oven every day and it works beautifully....with a few drawbacks. The words on the buttons are completely gone and there is some scratching on the shelving inside. It comes with adequate accessories except one that is crucial. Thermo protective gloves. I burn myself daily. Two of my burning adventures ended with treatments to the ER. Before buying, I read all the comments about the unit being dangerously hot. I knew this but bought it anyway.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Steep learning curve and amazing customer service
reviews.reviewText: Original review: I've had my Nuwave Bravo XL for a few days and I wish I could give it a glowing review, but after less than stellar results I can't. I think that over time, I will learn to work around its quirks. My version came with a number of accessories including a silicone mat and a mesh tray/rack but not an air fryer basket (I can use the mesh rack, though it's not as deep).The first head scratch moment was trying to assemble the racks in it since what I got didn't match the instructions. I'll figure out how best the racks and trays fit and ignore the manual. Note: the manual is easier to follow once you've used the Bravo a few times because you'll be more familiar with the knob and buttons.Tried to make toast, burnt the first and undercooked the second. I make my own bread, so will have to experiment with what will actually work, homemade bread seems to toast differently than store bought.Major issue with the warming function. I wanted to proof my pizza dough and chose the warming function. When chosen, it is supposed to default to 140 degrees for 1 hour. You can easily adjust temperature up or down. I readjusted it to 80 degrees. I followed the instructions. You can see the result in the picture (fortunately my husband noticed before we had a real disaster and only lost the container). When I checked the unit it was set to 350. I thought I had messed up, but have since tried this function, manual in hand and find that it ultimately defaults to 350 for 15 minutes. (I learned from customer service that the warm function kicks in after you've performed another function, i.e. bake at 350 for 15 minutes).So does it cook? Absolutely, but be very watchful until you really figure it out.Update 2/17/23: Company contacted me directly and provided guidance and acknowledged that the manual is not very clear and will look to adjust it in the future. 5 stars for customer service!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! Great air flyer
reviews.reviewText: I am amazed at the quality cooing this thing does. Very impressed. It’s our first air flyer and it does a phenomenal job on everything from pizza to chicken to toast etc…
